Package org.jsfml.graphics

Class ConvexShape

java.lang.Object
org.jsfml.internal.SFMLNativeObject
com.rubynaxela.kyanite.core.SFMLNativeObject
org.jsfml.graphics.Shape
org.jsfml.graphics.ConvexShape
All Implemented Interfaces:
Drawable, Transformable
public class ConvexShape extends Shape
Specialized shape representing a convex polygon.

  • Constructor Details

    • ConvexShape

      public ConvexShape()
      Constructs a new empty polygon.

    • ConvexShape

      public ConvexShape(int points)
      Constructs a new empty polygon and allocates a certain amount of points.

      This is equal to calling setPointCount(int) directly after construction of the polygon.

      Parameters:
      points - the amount of points of the polygon.

    • ConvexShape

      public ConvexShape(Vector2f... points)
      Constructs a new polygon from a given set of points.

      This is equal to calling setPoints(Vector2f...) directly after construction of the polygon.

      Parameters:
      points - the points of the polygon.

    • setPointCount

      public void setPointCount(int pointCount)
      Sets the amount of points that belong to the polygon.
      Parameters:
      pointCount - the amount of points of the polygon.

    • setPoint

      public void setPoint(int i, Vector2f v)
      Sets a point of the polygon.
      Parameters:
      i - the index of the point to set. Note that this index must be within the bounds of the polygon's point count, ie the point count needs to be set properly using setPointCount(int) first.
      v - the point to set at the given index.

    • setPoints

      public void setPoints(Vector2f... points)
      Sets the points of the polygon.

      The use of this method equals consecutive calls of setPointCount(int) and setPoint(int, Vector2f) for each point in the given array.

      Parameters:
      points - the points of the polygon.
